TextView.android:text: Data ID
Participant ID
SECTION IV: KMC
Do you know your baby’s weight at time of admission to this unit?
How much did your baby weigh? (grams)
Don’t know/don’t remember
Were you told about any ways to help your baby because your baby was born too soon or too small?
Do you remember a health worker talking to you about starting KMC? PROMPT: By KMC I mean that you tied the baby to your front for most of the day for lots of days
Did your baby receive KMC? PROMPT: By KMC I mean that you tied the baby to your front for most of the day for lots of days
Who did KMC with your baby?
06 What did the health worker tell you was the reason for putting your baby in KMC?
a) Keeping your small baby warm
b) Helping you to bond with your baby
c) Protecting your baby from infection
d) Helping you and your baby with breastfeeding
e) Helping your baby to grow
f) Other
g) Don’t know/don’t remember
07. Can you describe to me what position your baby should be in for KMC?
a) The baby is vertical
b) The baby is in direct skin to skin contact on the mother’s chest
c) The legs are flexed in a frog position
d) The cheek of the baby is in contact with the mother’s chest
e) The baby is wearing a hat
f) The baby is fixed firmly to the chest of the mother/care giver with a cloth shawl or (lycra) band, allowing the baby to move freely
g) The baby is wearing a nappy/diaper
h) The baby is wearing socks
i) Don’t know/don’t remember
08. What did the health worker talk to you about before you started KMC?
a) Keeping your baby in skin to skin contact in the kangaroo position all the time
b) How to feed your baby
c) The importance of hand hygiene
d) Arrangements for you to sleep, your meals and place to wash
e) How to look for any signs that your baby was seriously unwell
f) What to do if your baby showed signs that he was seriously unwell
g) Arrangements for other family members to help you and also provide kangaroo mother care
h) Don’t know/don’t remember
In the last 24hrs caring for your baby, how long was your baby in KMC position?
Don’t know/don’t remember
If you were not able to keep your baby in the KMC position in the last 24 hours, what reasons prevented you from doing this?
In the last 24hours, how many times did you feed your baby and what methods did you use? READ ANSWER CHOICES
Number of Time
Did a health worker explain to you how to recognise that your baby is seriously unwell?
13. Which signs of the baby being unwell did the health worker discuss?
a) Poor sucking or feeding
b) Temperature too low
c) Temperature too high
d) Baby floppy
e) Jaundice
f) Other
g) Don’t know/don’t remember
Did you receive a pre-discharge counselling session on KMC?
14a. What was discussed in the counselling session? DO NOT PROMPT AT FIRST, ASK WHAT ELSE, PROBE LAST IF NOT MENTIONED UNPROMPTED
a) kangaroo mother care position
b) Feeding practices
c) Follow up visits at hospital or health centre
How many days did you stay in the KMC section with your baby?
Don’t know/don’t remember
Do you know your babys weight at discharge from this unit?
How much does your baby weigh? (grams)
Don’t know/don’t remember
INTERVIEWER COMMENTS
